es.ucm.fdi.tp.practica6.ataxx.evaluator

Class AtaxxEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ucm.fdi.tp.practica6.ataxx.evaluator.AtaxxEvaluator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplexEvaluator, PieceCountingEvaluator

    public abstract class AtaxxEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which evaluates a game state (board, pieces, turn, piece) for the minmax algorithm. It also provides some useful methods that subclasses may want to use for their evaluations.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract double evaluate(Board board,
              java.util.List<Piece> pieces,
              Piece turn,
              Piece p)
        Evaluates how close the player p is to winning (1) or losing (-1). To be used in the automatic players. This method should at least return the neutral value (0) if there is no actual underlying algorithm that evaluates.

        The method must be called with a board that is InPlay, it cannot be called with a finished game.

        Parameters:
        board - The current board of the game.
        pieces - The list of pieces involved in the game (each correspond to a player).
        turn - The piece to be played next.
        p - The piece w.r.t which we want to make the evaluation
        Returns:
        How close the player turn is to winning (1) or losing (-1). The value 0 is neutral.

      • numberOfPiecesSurrounding

        protected static int numberOfPiecesSurrounding(Board board,
                            Piece surroundingType,
                            int row,
                            int col)
        Calculates the number of pieces of a type surrounding the position given.
        Parameters:
        board - the board.
        surroundingType - the type whose pieces will be counted.
        row - the row of the position.
        col - the column of the position.
        Returns:
        the number of pieces surrounding.

      • piecesSurrounding

        protected static java.util.HashMap<Piece,java.lang.Integer> piecesSurrounding(Board board,
                                                           int row,
                                                           int col)
        Calculates the number of pieces surrounding the position given, for each player.
        Parameters:
        board - the board.
        row - the row of the position.
        col - the column of the position.
        Returns:
        a hashmap with pieces as keys and number of pieces in the board as values.

      • totalPieces

        protected static int totalPieces(Board board,
              java.util.List<Piece> pieces)
        Counts the total pieces on the board.
        Parameters:
        board - the board.
        pieces - the list of possible pieces.
        Returns:
        the total number of pieces.
